resources.string: This is a color filter that multiplies the RGB channels by one color (mul), and then adds a second color (add), pinning the result for each component to [0..255]. \n\nThe alpha components of the mul and add arguments are ignored.
This is a color filter uses the specified color and porter-duff mode.

This is a color filter that transforms colors through a 4x5 color matrix. \n\nThe matrix is copied into the filter, so changes made to it after the filter is constructed will not be reflected in the filter.

Extracts prominent colors from an image. A number of colors with different profiles are extracted from the image: 
 • Vibrant 
 • Vibrant Dark 
 • Vibrant Light 
 • Muted 
 • Muted Dark 
 • Muted Light 
 • others via getSwatches() 

You can specify the maximum number of color swatches extracted from which the above six named ones are selected. Good values for maximumColorCount depend on the source image type. For landscapes, a good values are in the range 12–16. For images which are largely made up of people's faces then this value should be increased to 24–32. The default maximumColorCount is 16. The number of returned swatches may be less than maximumColorCount, but at least one is always returned. Not all of the above named ones are guaranteed to be found. 

A swatch consists of a main background color and two text colors. The text colors are guaranteed to have sufficient contrast when drawn over the background color. 

You can also specify the size of the image from which the palette is generated. The default is 192px. If the bitmap's largest dimension is greater than resizeBitmapSize, then the bitmap will be resized so that it's largest dimension matches the value. If the bitmap is smaller or equal, the original is used as-is. 
resizeBitmapSize has a large effect on the processing time. The larger the resized image is, the greater time it will take to generate the palette. The smaller the image is, the more detail is lost in the resulting image and thus less precision for color selection.
Use special built-in keyboards for color and floating point number inputs.
Look, what an awesome Color Filter I found!
